creator: hauser@acm.org
text:
http://nav.webring.org/navcgi?ring=apachesupport;list

<<404

Not Found
The requested URL /navcgi was not found on this server.

Apache/1.3.12 Server at 192.168.1.11 Port 80>>

creator: nd@perlig.de
text:
This looks like a configuration error. You're trying to get it from a machine in
your own network (Apache/1.3.12 Server at 192.168.1.11 Port 80>). You may also
consider to update. 1.3.12 is quite old.

The link works fine for me.

Thanks for using Apache!

Sorry, I am not running an httpd on my LAN and the error is produced by a very recent Mozilla browser (build 2003021208). I see that the below code of apache's site validates as good xhtml1 by w3c and I also see that it does work if you use MSIE, but I guess one of webring's multiple redirects/cookie setting attempts/annoying pop-up ads etc. is not compliant... Or do you think it is a problem of the latest Mozilla and I should post a bug there? Support
Webring P.S.: I guess, an open source site should not send me to a site that only works with a commercial browser...
creator: hauser@acm.org

text:
hrm. Seems they have problems on their servers. As I answered the site worked ;-)
Now I get the same error. (And no, I don't use IE, I'm running Phoenix ;-)
creator: nd@perlig.de

text:
However, since it may be a temporary problem, I'll set this bug to REMIND.

Thanks.
creator: nd@perlig.de

text: The site works fine now. So I'm happy to mark this bug invalid.
creator: nd@perlig.de
